edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class HudScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.HudScene

  • public class HudScene
extends java.lang.Object
    Hud is a heads-up display. It provides a means for putting things on the "Phone Screen" instead of "in the world".

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • makePicture

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable makePicture(float x,
                                                 float y,
                                                 float width,
                                                 float height,
                                                 java.lang.String imgName,
                                                 int zIndex)
        Add an image to the scene. The image will not have any physics attached to it.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner, in meters
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner, in meters
        width - The image width, in meters
        height - The image height, in meters
        imgName - The file name for the image, or ""
        zIndex - The z index of the text
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the image, so it can be enabled/disabled by program code

      • addText

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable addText(float x,
                                             float y,
                                             java.lang.String fontName,
                                             java.lang.String fontColor,
                                             int fontSize,
                                             java.lang.String prefix,
                                             java.lang.String suffix,
                                             TextProducer tp,
                                             int zIndex)
        Draw some text in the scene, using a bottom-left coordinate
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        fontName - The name of the font to use
        fontColor - The color of the font
        fontSize - The size of the font
        prefix - Prefix text to put before the generated text
        suffix - Suffix text to put after the generated text
        tp - A TextProducer that will generate the text to display
        zIndex - The z index of the text
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the text, so it can be enabled/disabled by program code

      • addTextCentered

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable addTextCentered(float centerX,
                                                     float centerY,
                                                     java.lang.String fontName,
                                                     java.lang.String fontColor,
                                                     int fontSize,
                                                     java.lang.String prefix,
                                                     java.lang.String suffix,
                                                     TextProducer tp,
                                                     int zIndex)
        Draw some text in the scene, centering it on a specific point
        Parameters:
        centerX - The x coordinate of the center
        centerY - The y coordinate of the center
        fontName - The name of the font to use
        fontColor - The color of the font
        fontSize - The size of the font
        prefix - Prefix text to put before the generated text
        suffix - Suffix text to put after the generated text
        tp - A TextProducer that will generate the text to display
        zIndex - The z index of the text
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the text, so it can be enabled/disabled by program code

      • addTapControl

        public SceneActor addTapControl(float x,
                                float y,
                                float width,
                                float height,
                                java.lang.String imgName,
                                TouchEventHandler action,
                                int zIndex)
        Add a button to the Scene, and provide code to run when the button is tapped
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - The width of the button
        height - The height of the button
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        action - The action to run in response to a tap
        zIndex - The z index for where this button will be drawn
        Returns:
        The button that was created
